001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.zeromq;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
004import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.internal.BitcoinClientThreadFactory;
005import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Flowable;
006import org.bitcoinj.core.Context;
007import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainBinaryService;
008import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.jsonrpc.RxBitcoinClient;
009
010import java.io.Closeable;
011import java.net.URI;
012import java.util.Optional;
013
014import static org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.zeromq.BitcoinZmqMessage.Topic.*;
015
016/**
017 * Service to listen for ZMQ messages from multiple TCP ports. Uses Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC to find
018 * the TCP address of the required services.
019 * TODO: Support using all topics, notjust `rawblock` and `rawtx`.
020 */
021public class RxBitcoinZmqBinaryService implements RxBlockchainBinaryService, Closeable {
022
023    protected final Network network;
024    protected final RxBitcoinClient client;
025    private final RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService blockService;
026    private final RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService txService;
027
028    private final Flowable<byte[]> flowableRawTx;
029    private final Flowable<byte[]> flowableRawBlock;
030
031    private final BitcoinClientThreadFactory threadFactory;
032
033    public RxBitcoinZmqBinaryService(Network network, URI rpcUri, String rpcUser, String rpcPassword) {
034        this(new RxBitcoinClient(network, rpcUri, rpcUser, rpcPassword));
035    }
036
037    public RxBitcoinZmqBinaryService(RxBitcoinClient client) {
038        this.client = client;
039        this.network = client.getNetwork();
040        threadFactory = new BitcoinClientThreadFactory(Context.getOrCreate(), "RxBitcoinZmq Thread");
041
042        // TODO: Create background thread to look for the ZMQ Ports
043        BitcoinZmqPortFinder portFinder = new BitcoinZmqPortFinder(client);
044
045        Optional<URI> blockServiceURI = portFinder.findPort(rawblock);
046        Optional<URI> txServiceURI = portFinder.findPort(rawtx);
047
048        if (!(blockServiceURI.isPresent() && txServiceURI.isPresent())) {
049            throw new RuntimeException("Bitcoin Core configuration error");
050        }
051
052        if (blockServiceURI.get().equals(txServiceURI.get())) {
053            // URIs are the same we can use a single connection
054            blockService = new RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService(blockServiceURI.get(), threadFactory, rawblock, rawtx);
055            txService = blockService;
056        } else {
057            blockService = new RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService(blockServiceURI.get(), threadFactory, rawblock);
058            txService = new RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService(txServiceURI.get(), threadFactory, rawtx);
059        }
060
061        flowableRawBlock = blockService.blockBinaryPublisher();
062        flowableRawTx = txService.transactionBinaryPublisher();
063    }
064
065    @Override
066    public Flowable<byte[]> transactionBinaryPublisher() {
067        return flowableRawTx;
068    }
069
070    @Override
071    public Flowable<byte[]> transactionHashBinaryPublisher() {
072        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented");
073    }
074
075    @Override
076    public Flowable<byte[]> blockBinaryPublisher() {
077        return flowableRawBlock;
078    }
079
080    @Override
081    public Flowable<byte[]> blockHashBinaryPublisher() {
082        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented");
083    }
084
085    @Override
086    public void close()  {
087        blockService.close();
088        txService.close();
089        try {
090            client.close();
091        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
092            throw new RuntimeException(e);
093        }
094    }
095
096
097
098}
